resources.string: JrDevStory
enter your name
start the job hunt!
Main Page artwork created by Luis Zuno (@ansimuz)

Alright %1$s, you\'ve got a couple projects you feel good about and you\'re ready to start your career as a Web Developer! You find a coffeeshop, get out your laptop (complete with sweet JavaScript and GitHub stickers), and start the job hunt!
Log onto Indeed.com and send out some applications.
Message people you$apos;ve met at meetups and tech events. Let them know you\'re looking for a gig.
You triple check your resume for typos and fire off some applications. A couple days later you hear back. Which option do you follow up with?
MegaTech, inc
TeenyStartup.io
You send out a few messages and manage not to sound too desperate. A couple days later you hear you get some referrals. Which option do you follow up with?
TeenyStartup.io
A freelance project
The founder of TeenyStartup.io messages you on Twitter. Eventually you manage to decipher his emojis and after a bit of back and forth, you set up an interview. How do you prepare?
Study up on Design Patterns, Data Structures, and Algorithms
Tag the founder in some üî•üî•üî• programmer memes on Insta and Twitter

You complete a phone screen, a take home coding test, a cognitive test, a personality test, a rental history form, a work history form, and provide 17 character references. You hear nothing from the recruiter for 2 weeks. How do you proceed?
Wait another 2 weeks, then reach out
It\'s been long enough, send a follow up email immediately
Your cat\'s sister\'s owner\'s neighbor\'s aunt needs some help with her Aquatic Yoga blog and e-store project.
Build it in WordPress
Set up a Tumblr
The founder snapchats you while using the dog filter...turns out you\'re not a good culture fit.
The recruiter tells you that the position has been filled. They also asked why you didn\'t return their calls...turns out they got you mixed up someone else named %1$s.
Turns out that founder of TeenyStartup.io, inc takes aquatic yoga classes from your client. They roast your "dev work" in a tweet-storm that goes viral. Your fledgling career does not recover.

You crush the interview. Your memes are üí™. your puns strike like ‚ö°. You sprinkle in some üêùbuzzwords like saltbae sprinkles salt. They love you. You never discuss the tech stack, or your job role, but who cares? You\'re offered the job on the spot!
The recruiter tells you that you\'re hired. They tried to tell you a week ago, but apparently the email bounced back to them.

Turns out that founder of TeenyStartup.io, inc takes aquatic yoga classes from your client. They praise your work and hold you up as an example for new freelancers to follow. You get several inquiries from new clients, are able to raise your rates, and can finally afford to rent a WeWerk office space.
You\'re hired! You code happily ever after, and git commit off into the sunset.
Story Page Image
Try again?
